content.raw:
I'm in the process adding PyQt5 support to qtutils as well as a abstraction wrapper around PyQt4, PyQt5 and PySide.

If someone is interested this can be found over at [my fork](#!/PhyNerd/qtutils/). Until now everything seems to work just fine on PyQt5.
Comments and Ideas for improvement would be nice :) 

The only thing thats missing is the build process in icons that still needs adjustment. I didn't quite understand what it's doing at first glance. If someone would like to provide some help there that would be very welcome!

The Qt wrapper is still very primitive and will be adjusted over time as I'm trying it out in the process of porting the labscript_suite.

Update: 
I tryed porting lyse to the new wrapper class and found some breakage. Fixed that breakage and lyse is now running on PyQt4 and 5 on my machine.
